node.plaintext:
Oriented toward Clojure, but I think it doubles as a nice piece on different
data structures & how to use them, and Doing Things with Functional Programming.

https://purelyfunctional.tv/guide/clojure-collections/
[https://purelyfunctional.tv/guide/clojure-collections/?__s=wvtwtdzek6uqqfiffffi]



http://michaelfeathers.typepad.com/michael_feathers_blog/2011/05/the-carrying-cost-of-code-taking-lean-seriously.html



  My friend gave this lecture!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cx1l65kOtrg



https://theintercept.com/2018/06/25/att-internet-nsa-spy-hubs/



https://www.businessinsider.com/super-kamiokande-neutrino-detector-is-unbelievably-beautiful-2018-6

node.plaintext:
https://www.quantamagazine.org/brains-may-teeter-near-their-tipping-point-20180614/

https://github.com/o1lab/xmysql

https://golem.ph.utexas.edu/category/2018/04/dynamical_systems_and_their_st.html

Kickin' rad MOOC that I'm taking right now, from a kickin' rad organization that
does kickin' rad research. 
https://www.complexityexplorer.org/courses/63-algorithmic-information-dynamics-a-computational-approach-to-causality-and-living-systems-from-networks-to-cells

node.plaintext:
I love it when you call me Big Data

http://blog.adnansiddiqi.me/getting-started-with-apache-kafka-in-python/

https://towardsdatascience.com/python-sets-and-set-theory-2ace093d1607

More useful than it sounds.

http://blog.lerner.co.il/python-parentheses-primer/

https://machinelearningmastery.com/statistical-sampling-and-resampling/

http://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005268
Related: https://arxiv.org/abs/1806.04793
